body_html: yeah, I though h can be applied to calculate gradients directly. I mean apply_gradients(h, types_lookup_table). But the size of h is different from gradients in h = sess.run(gradients), however, it seems that h is composed of three elements, and it needs some change to get the final gradients that can be applied to apply_gradients.
body_text: yeah, I though h can be applied to calculate gradients directly.  I mean apply_gradients(h, types_lookup_table). But the size of h is different from gradients in h = sess.run(gradients), however, it seems that h is composed of three elements, and it needs some change to get the final gradients that can be applied to apply_gradients.
body: yeah, I though h can be applied to calculate gradients directly.  I mean apply_gradients(h, types_lookup_table). But the size of h is different from gradients in h = sess.run(gradients), however, it seems that h is composed of three elements, and it needs some change to get the final gradients that can be applied to apply_gradients.
